episodeTitle: The End of the Battle is Nigh! Pound in the Finishing Move
description: The Straw Hats execute a coordinated team attack to finally defeat Oars, with Luffy delivering the finishing blow using Gear 3's Gigant Bazooka, breaking the giant's spine. However, Gecko Moria emerges and absorbs 1,000 shadows with his Shadows Asgard technique, transforming into a massive, grotesque monster.

events.title: First Episode to Feature 'We Are!' 2008 Remix Opening
events.description: This marks the debut of the 'We Are!' remix by Tohoshinki (TVXQ), created to commemorate the One Piece anime's 10th anniversary. The opening features brand-new animation celebrating the milestone.
events.significance: Commemorates 10 years of One Piece anime (1999-2009) and introduces a new visual style for the opening sequence.

events.title: Oars Recovers from Nightmare Luffy's Attack
events.description: Despite the devastating attack from Nightmare Luffy in the previous episode, Oars rises once again. The zombies cannot feel pain, making them extremely difficult to defeat through conventional means.
events.significance: Demonstrates the persistent threat of zombies and sets up the need for the Straw Hats' coordinated strategy to immobilize rather than just damage Oars.

events.title: Straw Hats Decide on Coordinated Final Attack
events.description: Rather than retreating in the face of Oars' recovery, the Straw Hats choose to stand together and execute a coordinated strategy. Every crew member, despite their injuries, gets back on their feet to contribute to the final assault.
events.significance: Showcases the Straw Hat crew's unity and determination, with each member playing a crucial role in the victory. This represents One Piece's core theme of teamwork over individual power.

events.title: Robin Uses Pierna Fleur
events.description: Nico Robin uses Pierna Fleur to sprout multiple legs along the outer wall of Thriller Bark's mast tower, creating footholds that allow Brook to carry Luffy to the top for the final attack.
events.significance: Demonstrates Robin's versatile use of her Hana Hana no Mi abilities for tactical support, and showcases the crew's coordination.

quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin creates footholds for Brook to climb

events.title: Nami's Rain Tempo Sets Up Freezing Attack
events.description: Nami uses her Clima-Tact to create Rain Tempo, soaking Oars from head to toe. This dampens the giant zombie in preparation for Franky and Usopp's freezing technique.
events.significance: Shows the strategic coordination between crew members, with Nami's weather manipulation enabling others' attacks.

events.title: Franky and Usopp's Combined Freezing Technique
events.description: Franky fires a Coup de Vent to power up a specialized freezing cannon, which Usopp helps operate. They freeze Oars' legs from the knees down, immobilizing the giant zombie's lower body.
events.significance: Demonstrates creative combination attacks and showcases how the crew's diverse abilities complement each other in battle.

events.title: Sanji Restrains Oars with Chains
events.description: Sanji secures chains around Oars' neck, using the ship's rudder mechanism to tighten them and further restrict the giant zombie's movement.
events.significance: Shows Sanji's tactical thinking and physical prowess in restraining such a massive opponent.

events.title: Chopper Explains Oars' Spine Anatomy
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper, using his medical knowledge, explains that Oars has an S-shaped spine. He reveals that if the spine is straightened, Oars will be unable to absorb the impact of attacks and will take full damage.
events.significance: Demonstrates Chopper's value as the crew's doctor and provides the strategic insight needed to defeat Oars. This medical knowledge becomes crucial to the victory.

quotes.text: Oars' spine is S-shaped! If we straighten it, he won't be able to absorb the impact!
quotes.speaker: Tony Tony Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper reveals the key to defeating Oars

events.title: Zoro Uses Santoryu Ougi: Sanzen Sekai
events.description: Roronoa Zoro unleashes his ultimate Three Sword Style technique, Santoryu Ougi: Sanzen Sekai (Three Thousand Worlds), to straighten Oars' S-shaped spine by forcing his way through the giant's stomach and pushing upward.
events.significance: Zoro uses one of his most powerful techniques to create the opening for Luffy's finishing blow. This demonstrates Zoro's crucial role in major battles.

quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro unleashes his ultimate technique to straighten Oars' spine

events.title: Luffy Defeats Oars with Gomu Gomu no Gigant Bazooka
events.description: From the top of Thriller Bark's mast, Luffy activates Gear 3 and unleashes Gomu Gomu no Gigant Bazooka, a devastating double-palm strike with both arms inflated to enormous size. The attack crashes into Oars' face with tremendous force, shattering the giant zombie's spine and finally defeating him.
events.significance: This is the climactic moment that ends the long battle against Oars. The Gear 3 technique's power is fully displayed, and the crew's coordinated strategy pays off. This marks the first major victory in the Thriller Bark arc's final battles.

quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy delivers the finishing blow to Oars

events.title: Oars is Defeated
events.description: Oars, the legendary continent-puller and one of the most fearsome zombies on Thriller Bark, crashes to the ground with his spine shattered. The giant zombie is completely immobilized and defeated, unable to rise again.
events.significance: Marks the end of one of the longest and most challenging battles the Straw Hats have faced. This victory demonstrates the crew's growth and ability to overcome seemingly impossible odds through teamwork.

events.title: Gecko Moria Emerges from Oars
events.description: After Oars' defeat, Gecko Moria emerges from the giant zombie's cockpit in Oars' stomach. Despite the defeat of his ultimate creation, Moria remains confident and prepares for his next move.
events.significance: Transitions the arc from the battle against Oars to the final confrontation with Gecko Moria himself, showing that the Straw Hats' ordeal is not yet over.

events.title: Moria Activates Shadows Asgard
events.description: Gecko Moria reveals his ultimate technique, Shadows Asgard. He absorbs all 1,000 shadows from every zombie on Thriller Bark, including those of his subordinates like Cindry, Hildon, and the zombie Lola. As he absorbs the shadows, the zombies drop lifeless to the ground.
events.significance: This is Moria's trump card and represents a massive power-up. While Luffy absorbed 100 shadows to become Nightmare Luffy, Moria absorbs 10 times that amount. This sets up the final, desperate battle of the arc.

quotes.text: You absorbed 100 shadows to become Nightmare Luffy... but I'm absorbing 1,000 shadows into my own body!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Moria explains his Shadows Asgard technique

events.title: Moria's Grotesque Transformation
events.description: As Gecko Moria absorbs 1,000 shadows, his body undergoes a horrifying transformation. He grows to a size rivaling Oars himself, becoming a massive, grotesque monster with short spindly legs, gigantic arms, and a huge bloated neck pulsating with veins. He demonstrates his newfound strength by punching the ground and creating a massive fissure across Thriller Bark.
events.significance: Establishes Moria as a devastating threat even after Oars' defeat. The transformation shows the terrifying potential of the Kage Kage no Mi when pushed to its limits. This creates a new, seemingly impossible challenge for the exhausted Straw Hats.

quotes.text: Oars' spine is S-shaped! If we straighten it, he won't be able to absorb the impact!
quotes.speaker: Tony Tony Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper reveals the key to defeating Oars

quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy delivers the finishing blow to Oars

quotes.text: You absorbed 100 shadows to become Nightmare Luffy... but I'm absorbing 1,000 shadows into my own body!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Moria explains his Shadows Asgard technique

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the power of teamwork as every Straw Hat crew member contributes their unique abilities to defeat Oars. No single member could have won alone - victory required perfect coordination and trust in each other.
themes.symbolism: Each crew member's attack represents a link in a chain, with Luffy's finishing blow being the culmination of everyone's efforts.

themes.description: Despite Oars' overwhelming strength, the Straw Hats win through tactical thinking. Chopper's medical knowledge, combined with creative use of each member's abilities, proves more effective than brute force.
themes.symbolism: The coordinated attack represents the idea that intelligence and strategy can overcome seemingly insurmountable physical advantages.

themes.description: Just when victory seems assured with Oars' defeat, an even greater threat emerges in Moria's transformed state. This pattern of escalating challenges tests the crew's resolve and endurance.
themes.symbolism: Moria's transformation represents how challenges can evolve and intensify, requiring continuous adaptation and perseverance.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy delivers the decisive blow using Gear 3, showcasing his growth in power and his role as the crew's strongest fighter. However, the episode also shows his reliance on his crew's support to create the opening for his attack.
keyActions: Carried to the mast top by Brook
Uses Gear 3 to inflate both arms
Delivers Gomu Gomu no Gigant Bazooka to defeat Oars

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro demonstrates his strength and tactical importance by using his ultimate technique to straighten Oars' spine, creating the critical opening for Luffy's attack.
keyActions: Forces his way into Oars' stomach
Straightens Oars' spine to maximize damage

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper's medical expertise proves crucial to victory, as he identifies Oars' anatomical weakness. This showcases his value beyond just healing the crew.
keyActions: Identifies the S-shaped spine as a weakness
Provides the key insight that leads to victory
quotes: Oars' spine is S-shaped! If we straighten it, he won't be able to absorb the impact!

characterSpotlights.development: After his ultimate creation Oars is defeated, Moria reveals his true power by absorbing 1,000 shadows and transforming into a monstrous form, establishing himself as the final obstacle the Straw Hats must overcome.
keyActions: Absorbs all 1,000 shadows from Thriller Bark zombies
Demonstrates power by splitting the ground
quotes: You absorbed 100 shadows to become Nightmare Luffy... but I'm absorbing 1,000 shadows into my own body!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the coordinated attack sequence with additional animation showing each crew member's contribution in more detail than the manga panels.
The anime adds more dramatic reactions from the Rolling Pirates and other shadow victims witnessing the battle.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode to use the 'We Are!' 2008 remix by Tohoshinki (TVXQ) as the opening theme, created to commemorate the One Piece anime's 10th anniversary (1999-2009).

sources.title: We Are!/Tohoshinki (2008) Remix - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Both Luffy's Japanese voice actress (Mayumi Tanaka) and English voice actress (Colleen Clinkenbeard) also voice Oars in this episode, as Oars has Luffy's shadow and personality.

sources.title: Oars Voice - One Piece - Behind The Voice Actors

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 480 (pages 2-19) and Chapter 481 (pages 2-13) of the manga.
One Piece stopped using ending songs after episode 279, so this episode has no ending theme despite airing in 2008.

sources.title: Why did the anime stop having ending songs since episode 279?

trivia.fact: Moria's Shadows Asgard technique represents a tenfold increase over Nightmare Luffy's power, as he absorbs 1,000 shadows compared to Luffy's 100.
The Gomu Gomu no Gigant Bazooka used to defeat Oars first appeared in the manga in Volume 49, Chapter 480, pages 16-19.

sources.title: Gomu Gomu no Mi/Gear 3 Techniques - One Piece Wiki
